intro: Malvastrum boyuibeanum, commonly known as the African mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
